programme.title: This Old House

programme.title: This Old House

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: What's for Sunday dinner? Around many American tables, it's meat and potatoes. Beef brisket is a good choice and a nice change from pot roast or beef stew. Although inexpensive and simple to prepare, brisket does pose some challenges to the cook.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: There are certain dinners we rely on again and again. We are particularly fond of roasting chicken and potatoes together in one pan. While the chicken roasts, its juices drip onto the potatoes, giving them a wonderfully rich crust and creamy flavor.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We develop a foolproof preparation for pork chops with vinegar and peppers—a modern version tangy and juicy enough to rival that prepared by an Italian grandmother. Next, we turn to pan-roasted pork tenderloin.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Tuna, which is often served rare to medium-rare, can be particularly tricky to get just right with a nicely seared crust. As for halibut, we developed a technique that ensured perfect texture without a loss of flavor.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Some people are intimidated by the thought of preparing fish. Traditional dishes, like Fish Meunière, can seem even more daunting. But you don't need to be wearing a toque to prepare this French classic well.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Most Italian recipes seem startlingly easy to prepare, requiring just a few simple ingredients. But some dishes need special care to reach their full potential. In this episode, we demystify two Italian classics: Fettuccine Alfredo and Beef in Barolo.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: In this episode, we prepare an Indian-inspired shrimp curry and a Thai-inspired green curry with chicken.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: When you eat chicken frequently, it pays to have a number of preparations on hand. In this episode, we turn to orange-flavored chicken and chicken teriyaki.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: One of our favorite Spanish dishes is paella. But with a lengthy ingredient list the shopping alone can give the home cook pause. We take a hard look at paella to see if we can pare back this dish to its humble origins without losing its alluring flavors.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We set out to develop a hassle-free pizza recipe especially for the grill—one we hope will become a new backyard barbecue favorite.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Pork loin is delicious roasted in the oven, but it takes on a new character when cooked on the grill. The fire imparts a delicate smokiness to the meat, and the heat creates a handsome crust. French potato salad is a perfect counterpoint to the pork.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We wanted to develop a recipe for pulled pork that rivals that of the best barbecue joints but won't be an all-day affair. We pair the pork with another barbecue classic—cornbread.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: If you're a fan of saucy barbecued chicken, you'll love pulled chicken. Similar to the more traditional pulled pork, it's simply tender shreds of smoky grilled chicken moistened with barbecue sauce.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Summer desserts are all about fruit. As inviting as a bowl of sweet berries can be, there's something about baked fruit desserts that we can't resist. In this episode we take a look at two summer favorites: blueberry cobbler and free-form fruit tart.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: With its impressive mounds of tender, juicy apples and melt-in-your-mouth pastry crust, deep-dish apple pie should take your breath away. Creating a pie with such a high volume of filling does, however, pose challenges.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: There seems to be a cookie to fit any occasion or mood. In this episode we look at two from opposite ends of the style spectrum—the thick, homey oatmeal and the dainty, elegant spritz.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: In this episode, we aim to resurrect the traditional birthday cake. We've developed an honest-to-goodness layer cake with an old-fashioned jam filling and real butter frosting—the type of cake guaranteed to put a smile on anyone's face.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: German chocolate cake—filled with sticky pecans and coconut—is not without flaws. We set out to develop a German chocolate cake that avoids the common pitfalls and delivers on its promise.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We set out to make a meatloaf with well-seasoned meat and just enough binder to give the loaf a tender, not tough, texture. In choosing a side dish to partner with our meatloaf, we turned to another old-fashioned dish—skillet-roasted potatoes.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Dinners prepared entirely in one skillet are perfect for weeknight cooking. Less cleanup is one obvious benefit. A skillet also gives the cook a bit more control over cooking multiple elements.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Beef, beer, and onions have a natural affinity—it's one reason burgers and onion rings are often on bar menus. In a carbonnade, the beef melds with the soft sweetness of sliced onions in a lightly thickened broth that is rich, deep, and satisfying.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We wanted a streamlined version of roast chicken with plenty of stuffing to go around. First, we needed to solve the problem of cooking the stuffing to a safe temperature without drying out the delicate breast meat of the chicken.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Boneless pork chops are lean and quick-cooking, making them ideal for weeknight meals. Pork tenderloin, which is also lean, has a somewhat fussy reputation, but you don't need to be a professional chef to cook tenderloin properly.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We make a fresh-tasting, quick tamale pie with a juicy, spicy mixture of meat and vegetables and a quick homemade-cornbread topping. We also show you how to cook up a really flavorful chicken stew topped with a biscuit crust.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Whether we admit it or not, there are some dishes that are a little too high in fat and calories to be enjoyed on a regular basis. Even a modest portion of macaroni and cheese or chicken Parmesan is prohibitive. But that doesn't need to be the case.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We wanted to be able to serve English-style fish and chips—large pieces of moist and delicate cod in a crisp and tender coating with thick-cut fries—at home.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Commonly found at catered events, this once-highbrow dish has become a bit of a joke. But after preparing several cookbook versions, we realized that pairing a crisp-fried coating with a delicate butter sauce was a great idea that deserved a revival.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: While the hallmark of this filet mignon is its tender texture, some argue that the beefy flavor is too mild, lacking the oomph of fattier cuts like rib eye. So we aim to boost the filet mignon's flavor with a peppercorn crust and a rich pan sauce.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We love a good stir-fry served with rice, but a noodle cake, a savory round of tender noodles sautéed in a skillet until the exterior is crisp, is also a great base for a saucy stir-fry.
programme.sub-title: Stir-Fried Chicken with Crispy Noodle Cake

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We prepare a Thai-inspired beef stir-fry and share a recipe for great potstickers.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We create tasty versions of two Tex-Mex favorites: chicken fajitas and huevos rancheros.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Just when we think we've become familiar with every Italian dish under the sun, we're pleasantly surprised to come across one we've somehow overlooked—Spaghetti with Marinara Sauce.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Fifty years ago, steak Diane was prepared tableside and included a burst of pyrotechnics supplied by a match and some cognac. Sure, such theatrics might seem a bit dated and silly, but they are essential to the flavor of the dish. We explain why.

programme.title: The Kill Room
programme.desc: A hitman, his boss, an art dealer and a money-laundering scheme that accidentally turns the assassin into an overnight avant-garde sensation, one that forces her to play the art world against the underworld.

programme.title: Jane Got a Gun
programme.desc: A woman asks her ex-lover for help in order to save her outlaw husband from a gang out to kill him.

programme.title: Thelma & Louise
programme.desc: In one of the greatest road movies of all time, Geena Davis and Susan Sarandon ride to everlasting fame as two women who embark on a crime spree across the American southwest.

programme.title: Mystic Pizza
programme.desc: The coming-of-age of three best friends who work at a pizzeria in the seaside town of Mystic, Connecticut.

programme.title: Marie Antoinette
programme.desc: Written and directed by Academy Award winner Sofia Coppola, Marie Antoinette is an electrifying yet intimate re-telling of the turbulent life of history's favorite villainess. Rated: PG-13

programme.title: Across the Universe
programme.desc: A love story about a British boy and an American girl set against the backdrop of the social upheaval of the 1960s.

programme.title: Attack the Block
programme.desc: ATTACK THE BLOCK is a fast, funny, frightening action adventure movie that pits a teen street gang against an invasion of savage alien monsters. It turns a crazy mix of tough street kids into a team of kick ass heroes.

programme.title: The Fisher King
programme.desc: Parry, a homeless history professor, lives in a fantasy world full of castles, Red Knights and damsels in distress. Bridges co-stars as Jack, New York's #1 shock deejay, whose off-hand arrogance triggers a tragedy which ruins his career. Rated: R

programme.title: The Chaperone
programme.desc: Ray’s been asked to chaperone a school trip with his daughter Sally’s class. When characters from Ray’s criminal past believe he stole the loot from a bank they robbed, Ray will do whatever it takes to keep his daughter and her class out of harms way.

programme.title: Mail Order Monster
programme.desc: A girl seeks help and guidance from a robot monster to cope with the bullies at school and her father's new girlfriend.

programme.title: Grace and Goliath
programme.desc: Hollywood big-shot Josh Jenkins sweeps into Belfast to make a movie, but before long his world crashes and he loses everything. Hotel cleaner Lily invites him to stay with her family and gradually the people of this 'strange' city touch his heart forever.

programme.title: Kids From Planet 62F
programme.desc: Four friends find an object with special powers that belongs to two alien kids from the planet 62F. Now they must race to get it back to its rightful owners, but NASA are on their tail and they will stop at nothing to get their hands on it.

programme.title: Switched
programme.desc: Tired of being bullied, Cassandra Evans prays that her nemesis, Katie Sharp, the queen bee of social media, would know what it's like to walk a day in her shoes. Her prayer is answered in an unexpected way when they get "Switched."

programme.title: A.R.C.H.I.E: A.R.C.H.I.E
programme.desc: Isabel has recently lost her parents in a car accident. Feeling alone and friendless, she befriends a stray robot dog named A.R.C.H.I.E. who can talk, run at blinding speed and has super strength and x-ray vision and they become fast friends.

programme.title: Captain Sabertooth
programme.desc: The orphan boy Pinky follows the Captain on an exciting and dangerous journey across the big oceans to the kingdom of Lama Rama, hunting for a treasure and the answer to who is Pinky's father.

programme.title: F.R.E.D.I.
programme.desc: Prepare for an adventure that's out of this world! When an intelligent, lovable robot, known as F.R.E.D.I., goes missing from a secret government research facility it's found by 15 year old James.

programme.title: The Sorcerer's Apprentice
programme.desc: Ben Clark yearns to learn magic from his new neighbor, Milner. Milner hesitates to help Ben because he carries the same scar as the original bearer of an ancient staff that was wielded in the battle between good and evil 1,400 years ago.

programme.title: The Adventures of Pinocchio
programme.desc: One of puppet-maker Geppetto's creations, a puppet called Pinocchio, magically comes to life. In order to become a real boy, Pinocchio must go on a daring adventure and learn valuable lessons.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Into The Storm
programme.desc: Bad weather threatens to end the fishing week for the Gloucester fishermen, but while some boats head for home, others decide to take on Mother Nature's wrath.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Operation T.U.N.A
programme.desc: As the hunt for blue fin tuna intensifies, the fisherman resort to espionage for information.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Bite Fight
programme.desc: It's the fifth week of the season and the entire fleet battle for the most successful fishing spots.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Mission: Fishin!
programme.desc: As Gloucester's Bluefin tuna fleet charges into the heart of the fishing season, it's a tight race for the coveted title of top-earning boat.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Bad Latitude
programme.desc: It's almost halfway through the North Atlantic bluefin tuna season and the Gloucester fleet has hit a lull in fishing.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Battle Royale
programme.desc: With the second half of the North Atlantic bluefin tuna fishing season now underway, competition amongst the Gloucester fleet intensifies when tuna become scarce.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Brotherly Shove
programme.desc: A new week calls for new techniques as the Gloucester Captains try unconventional methods to hook their next paycheck.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Blue Grit
programme.desc: Time is running out in the North Atlantic bluefin tuna season and, this week, every boat in the Gloucester fleet is facing a different challenge.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Tuna Beta Kappa
programme.desc: The tuna fishermen of Gloucester, Massachusetts, know that they have to rely on each other to get the job done, but sometimes trusting the competition isn't such a good idea.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Bad Blood
programme.desc: Three weeks left of bluefin tuna season, the Gloucester fleet is desperate to haul in a monster.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Sharks and Recreation
programme.desc: With only three weeks left in the North Atlantic Bluefin Tuna season, the pressure begins to take a toll on the captains.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: The Mighty Bite
programme.desc: With only two weeks left in the fishing season and the price of blue fin tuna on the rise, the Gloucester captains race to bring in record hauls.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: The Reckoning
programme.desc: There is only one week of fishing left in the North Atlantic Bluefin Tuna season and the Gloucester fleet is set for a final showdown in a bid to catch the last monster tuna of the year.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Head To Tail (Special)
programme.desc: It's a look back at the best moments from two seasons of Wicked Tuna, featuring the wildest catches and fiercest rivalries, plus a sneak peek at the upcoming third season.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: The Wicked Return
programme.desc: The fishermen of Gloucester, Massachusetts, set out for Jeffrey's Ledge in hopes of catching the first fish of the North Atlantic Bluefin Tuna Season.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Checkmate
programme.desc: It's week two of the North Atlantic Blue Fin Tuna Season and the Gloucester captains and their crews, from rookies to old pros, get put to the test.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Into The Storm
programme.desc: Bad weather threatens to end the fishing week for the Gloucester fishermen, but while some boats head for home, others decide to take on Mother Nature's wrath.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Operation T.U.N.A
programme.desc: As the hunt for blue fin tuna intensifies, the fisherman resort to espionage for information.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Bite Fight
programme.desc: It's the fifth week of the season and the entire fleet battle for the most successful fishing spots.

programme.title: The Power of One
programme.desc: An orphan terrorized for his family's political beliefs, young PK turns to his only friend: a kindly, world-wise prisoner who teaches him how to box.

programme.title: The Space Between Us
programme.desc: During the first ever mission to colonize Mars, the lead astronaut discovers that she is pregnant. Shortly after landing, she dies while giving birth to the first human born on Mars.

programme.title: Equals
programme.desc: In a seemingly utopian world, crime and violence have been eradicated by genetically eliminating all human emotions. Despite this, two coworkers, Nia and Silas, develop a growing attraction that leads to a forbidden and passionate romance.

programme.title: Beyond a Reasonable Doubt
programme.desc: A remake of the 1956 film noir classic "Beyond a Reasonable Doubt" in which a writer's plan to expose a corrupt district attorney takes an unexpected turn.

programme.title: Donnie Darko
programme.desc: Troubled adolescent Donnie Darko receives a disturbing vision that the world will end in 28 days. Stars Jake & Maggie Gyllenhal

programme.title: The Circle
programme.desc: Mae is ecstatic to be employed in the biggest tech company in the world. But after she gets involved in an experiment that could change the world, she realises its adverse consequences.

programme.title: Take Shelter
programme.desc: Oscar nominees Michael Shannon and Jessica Chastain star in this psychological thriller about a young husband and father plagued by apocalyptic visions. He must decide whether to shelter his family from a coming storm — or from himself.

programme.title: High Life
programme.desc: Monte and his daughter are the last survivors of a dangerous mission to deep space. The crew—death-row inmates led by a sinister doctor—has vanished. As the mystery of what happened onboard unravels, father and daughter must rely on each other to survive.

programme.title: The Starving Games
programme.desc: A spoof movie that references The Hunger Games, The Avengers, Sherlock Holmes, and the Harry Potter saga.

programme.title: Swimming with Men
programme.desc: A man who is suffering a mid-life crisis finds new meaning in his life as part of an all-male, middle-aged, amateur synchronised swimming team.

programme.title: The Starving Games

programme.title: The Beach Bum
programme.desc: THE BEACH BUM follows the hilarious misadventures of Moondog (Matthew McConaughey), a rebellious rogue who always lives life by his own rules.

programme.title: Surf Party
programme.desc: A group of teens and a veteran surfer take a road trip from Ventura, California to the San Fernando Valley in order to track down a prized stolen surfboard.

programme.title: The Beach Bum
programme.desc: THE BEACH BUM follows the hilarious misadventures of Moondog (Matthew McConaughey), a rebellious rogue who always lives life by his own rules.

programme.title: Marry Me in Yosemite
programme.desc: Zoe, a notable photojournalist, visits Yosemite landscapes made famous by Ansel Adams. When she meets Jack, an intriguing tour guide, he opens her eyes to new adventures as they embark on a journey.

programme.title: Unleashing Mr. Darcy
programme.desc: Idealistic dog handler Elizabeth Bennett finds herself repeatedly judged in dog show rings by philanthropist Donovan Darcy. What she doesn’t count on is an unstoppable attraction to the billionaire dog breeder.

programme.title: My Birthday Romance
programme.desc: Callie Fitzgerald is tired of her family fixing her up and questioning her single status. She is determined to find a pretend boyfriend for her 35th birthday party just so her family will leave her alone.

programme.title: Wedding Season
programme.desc: Journalist Trish is on back-to-back bridesmaid duty for her three best friends. Finding herself without a date, she pairs up with photographer Ryan, the brother of her best friend.

programme.title: The Wedding Contract
programme.desc: Rebecca, a teacher, and Adam, an ad executive are excited to plan their Jewish wedding, but their wedding and future are put into jeopardy when Adam lands a new ad campaign, and their mothers meet.

programme.title: The Love Club: Lauren
programme.desc: Lauren dreams of opening an art gallery while dealing with her mixed emotions about her husband. She recruits The Love Club to help her move on, but instead they come up with a plan to keep them together.

programme.title: Love Under the Rainbow
programme.desc: Lucy wasn't sure if she would find true love, until Jack moves to town with his daughter Sophie. Together they teach her it's never too late to start chasing rainbows!

programme.title: Once Upon a Prince
programme.desc: Susanna gladly accepts help one day from handsome stranger Nate at her parents’ garden store in small-town Georgia.

programme.title: A Picture of Her
programme.desc: Beth unwittingly becomes the subject of an award-winning magazine’s cover and goes on a quest to uncover the true identity of the mystery photographer who snapped her photo.

programme.title: A Valentine's Match
programme.desc: Fired from her job as a reality TV host, Natalie returns home for Valentine's Day, only to find herself running the town festival's auction with her ex-fiancé thanks to two scheming mothers.

programme.title: Christmas CEO
programme.desc: A small toy company CEO gets a once in a lifetime offer to merge with a mega toy company but will need her estranged ex-business partner's signature to seal the deal.

programme.title: In Merry Measure
programme.desc: When pop star Darcy returns home to spend Christmas with her sister and niece, she unexpectedly finds herself coaching the high school choir with her onetime rival, Adam.

programme.title: A Christmas Treasure
programme.desc: After opening a 100-year-old time capsule and meeting a charming chef, Lou questions whether or not she should move to New York after Christmas and further her writing career.

programme.title: With Love, Christmas
programme.desc: Melanie Welch is a hard-working ad executive who finds herself teamed up with uptight coworker Donovan Goodwin to come up with the ultimate Christmas commercial for a new cell phone.

programme.title: Hearts of Christmas
programme.desc: To the devoted caregivers of the Community Memorial Hospital NICU, every 'premie' heartbeat is a precious gift, and every family whose baby they care for is like their own.

programme.title: Boyfriends of Christmas Past
programme.desc: Leading up to Christmas, marketing executive, Lauren, is visited by the ghosts of four ex boyfriends. She must learn to open her heart or risk losing her best friend, Nate.

programme.title: Royal Nanny
programme.desc: MI5 agent Claire goes undercover as the royal nanny, and must overcome the challenges of her assignment, like resisting the charms of Prince Colin while keeping the family safe at Christmas.

programme.title: Poinsettias for Christmas
programme.desc: t's just weeks before Christmas when Ellie, gets a call to return home to help her father on the family's poinsettia farm.

programme.title: The Christmas Doctor
programme.desc: Zoey is a traveling doctor who prefers short assignments to staying put, so when she is assigned to a small town clinic for the holidays, she is surprised when she starts to feel at home.

programme.title: A Dickens of a Holiday!
programme.desc: To make the 100th anniversary of her hometown’s Victorian festival a success, Cassie invites action movie star and former high school classmate Jake to play Scrooge in 'A Christmas Carol'.

programme.title: Secret Life Of Deer
programme.desc: 30 million white-tailed deer live in the United States. They have begun to adapt themselves to living in a world of traffic, pets and backyards. In Cayuga Heights, New York, the suburb’s residents are trying to get used to this exceptional living arrangement. The deer can be spotted daily from kitchen windows and porches. Life in the suburbs is deer heaven – large areas of grass, no predators and plenty of water means their population is on a steady rise. In this documentary, white-tailed deer are outfitted with special cameras to take the viewer into their world. 'Deercam' allows us to see them in a new light – not frozen in the headlights of a car or as shy residents of the woods, but as intelligent and affectionate family animals.

programme.title: Unnatural Selection
programme.desc: The wings of cliff swallows in Nebraska are getting shorter – while female turtles in Chesapeake Bay are getting larger. On the Galapagos Islands, two species of finches are developing back into one. Increasing numbers of peregrine falcons are living in urban areas – and have adapted their behaviour: thanks to the city lights, they have learned to hunt at night.

programme.title: Wild Prairie Man
programme.desc: Located in the Northern Great Plains of Canada, Grasslands National Park has been a 20 year odyssey for wildlife photographer James R. Page. For James, critters are more interesting than people and he shares some of his iconic images and experiences from this endangered ecosystem. We showcase the parks wilderness that is dominated by prairie light and dark sky, the wildlife, prairie dogs, mesmerizing landscapes, and bisons. We immerse ourselves in the wild habitat of Grasslands National Park for over a year capturing some never before scenes in the Wild Prairie. James R. Page's connection to the land and the wildlife provides an unforgettable journey into the heart of this endangered ecosystem, while Park experts help us understand its complexity.

programme.title: Survival of the Fittest in the Alps
programme.desc: The documentary shows the survival strategies of various animal species in the high mountains of the Alps in winter. Despite freezing temperatures and limited food supply, chamois, red deer and snow hares manage to survive the cold months. Latest research reveals the amazing abilities the animals have developed to adapt to the extreme conditions and also how climate change is altering the behaviour of the alpine inhabitants.

programme.title: Leap Of The Lynx
programme.desc: On the Iberian Peninsula, primeval landscapes are practically non-existent, so the Iberian lynx has lived on cultivated land for centuries – cattle, horse and pig pastures, cork oak forests, timberland, and even holy sites of pilgrimage. The diversity and beauty of these locations are truly stunning and their character and history as relevant to this story as that of the big cat itself. Until five years ago, both populations of Iberian lynx were quickly fading away. Their fragmented habitats were shrinking even further, they were starved by lack of prey and reduced by epidemics. But now, local authorities, scientists, landowners, and other groups have finally begun to act in unison.

programme.title: The Moor
programme.desc: Moors and peatlands are oases in the cultivated landscape of Central Europe.

programme.title: Children of the Sun
programme.desc: Butterflies surely are the most fancied species inside the insect world. Their beautiful colouring and their graceful flight appeal to everyone. There are close to 4000 types of Butterflies – today many of them are endangered due to the loss of their habitat.

programme.title: Children of the Sun
programme.sub-title: Children of the Sun - Wild Bees
programme.desc: Most people associate honey producing insects with the name “BEE“. Few realize that there are over 560 different species of bees - most of them live their lives “busy as a bee“ but some “abuse“ other insects and others are even known to be murderers. The film “Wild Bees” shows the incredible diversity and the stunning adaptations of our “BEES” to various habitats and diverse living conditions. Fascinating fights, sensational performances, imposing structures and colorful individuals – the world of “Wild Bees” offers all of this and more.

programme.title: Mantises - Masters of Deception
programme.desc: They are killers. They kill with unbelievable precision. They fight Kung Fu style and are seen in Japan as a symbol of vigilance - the mantises. Their triangular head with its unique flexibility is conspicuous. Two overdimensioned eyes fixate the distance to their prey rapidly and three-dimensionally. The chest segment of the mantis is prolonged and equipped with spiny appendages that can spear their prey as fast as a jack knife. The mysterious aura that surrounds the praying mantis has a lot to do with the fact that they are rarely seen. They have adapted to their surroundings perfectly. No matter whether leaves, blossoms, tree bark, sandy floors or even orchids - the mantis adjusts to all environments.

programme.title: Follow Your Cat
programme.desc: Follow us while we follow cats on their hunting grounds for mice and birds. Experience the double life of your domestic tiger... she will lead you on adventures that you never thought were possible. With a behavioural scientist that specializes in cats and modern technology we follow the cat on their wanderings into the wild. She maps their routes, unveils their secret favourite places, chronicles their territorial conquests, and shows us the entertaining habits of this enigmatic creature.

programme.title: Dust And Stripes
programme.desc: In a never-ending quest for grass and water, the striped herds undertake an annual epic trek across the vast lunar landscape of the Kalahari’s Makgadikgadi Pans. Most of the year, the Makgadikgadi is an inhospitable wasteland of windswept, salt-encrusted pans. For the area’s water-dependent zebra, the Boteti River on the western edge of the pans is a dry-season lifeline. However, it is also a death trap, with lions waiting in ambush and crocodiles lurking in dark riverside caves.

programme.title: Namibia`s Desert Kingdom
programme.desc: Although the dunes are barren, the dry riverbeds show signs of growth. And out of the heat, vast shapes appear. A herd of desert elephants ambles along the dry riverbed sniffing the ground with their lazy trunks. These remarkable creatures can smell the water underground and know where to find it. An abandoned well attracts a troop of chacma baboons, followed by a small herd of oryx and springbok, and finally a group of jackals. None of them has seen the pride of desert lions lying in wait.

programme.title: Germany's Wild Birds
programme.desc: By monitoring ten interesting bird-watching locations, we document not only the silver herons in the Westerwald, but also the last great bustards in Havelland. Then there are the great crested grebes in their splendid plumages, shown building their nests and during courtship, in an area of extinct volcanoes: the Eiffel. Add to this, exotic wild birds and colorful parakeets, the newest members of the population in a park in Wiesbaden. We have resting migratory birds, ducks and waders on the west banks of the Steinhuder Lake. On the border to the Netherlands, in the moorlands near Münster, we find the only wild flamingos in Germany. Equally interesting are the fire geese, avocets and many birds of the coastal region not far from Hamburg harbor. At Federsee Lake in Upper Swabia, we observe the inhabitants of the extensive reed zones: bearded tits. Then we have the birds of fortune, the cranes, which interrupt their long journeys by resting on the Baltic coast. Last, but not least, in the Feldberg lake region we accompany the ranger on an exciting sea eagle excursion. With this film, you are invited to experience a journey through the wonderful world of birds.

programme.title: Cuckoo - The Enemy in My Nest
programme.desc: It’s no news that cuckoos are brood parasites: they lay their eggs into the nests of other bird species – a clever trick that spares the rearing of own offspring. Some even go as far as to kill the other chicks in the nest. But why do other parent birds let this happen? Are they too stupid? Too inept? Or simply clueless? Admittedly, cuckoo’s eggs do look deceptively genuine. But the cuckoo chick? Not even remotely! It quickly grows into a giant that looks nothing like its new family. So why don’t the adoptive parents notice the sham then? Until recently, the ornithologists’ theory was: the “victims” have yet to learn to counteract. Turns out: they may even profit from having strangers’ chicks in their nest! So is cuckoo’s behaviour a phenomenal trick or an evolutionary riddle?

programme.title: Beak & Brain - Genius Birds from Down Under
programme.desc: These child prodigies of the animal kingdom have feathers and beaks – and very special skills! The Keas of New Zealand are the only parrots that live in snowy mountain areas. They like testing their brains, solving puzzles and challenging tourists: they unscrew bottle-tops, dismantle windscreen wiper blades and tear open rucksacks. They seem so determined you’d think they have an understanding of physics and mechanics! Thousands of miles northwards, in New Caledonia, other birds have talent, too. Here bird expert Gavin Hunt discovered that crows are able to produce a whole set of tools, each designed for a particular purpose – the most intricate tool culture in the animal kingdom! These high flyers compete against each other: Keas vs Crows. What is the secret of their intelligence? It’s the ultimate avian I.Q. test, with some funny and surprising results.

programme.title: North America's National Parks
programme.desc: The Grand Canyon is a steep-sided canyon carved by the Colorado River in Arizona, United States. The Grand Canyon is 277 miles (446 km) long, up to 18 miles (29 km) wide and attains a depth of over a mile (6,093 feet or 1,857 meters). The canyon and adjacent rim are contained within Grand Canyon National Park, the Kaibab National Forest, Grand Canyon–Parashant National Monument, the Hualapai Indian Reservation, the Havasupai Indian Reservation and the Navajo Nation. President Theodore Roosevelt was a major proponent of preservation of the Grand Canyon area and visited it on numerous occasions to hunt and enjoy the scenery.

programme.title: North America's National Parks
programme.sub-title: America's National Parks - Gates of the Arctic
programme.desc: Gates of the Arctic National Park and Preserve is an American national park that protects portions of the Brooks Range in northern Alaska. The park is the northernmost national park in the United States, situated entirely north of the Arctic Circle. The park is the second largest in the US, slightly larger in area than Belgium. Gates of the Arctic was initially designated as a national monument on December 1, 1978, before being redesignated as a national park and preserve upon passage of the Alaska National Interest Lands Conservation Act in 1980. A large part of the park has additional protection as the Gates of the Arctic Wilderness that adjoins the Noatak Wilderness. They form the largest contiguous wilderness in the United States together. Fauna include brown bears, black bears, muskoxen, moose, Dall sheep, timber wolves, wolverines, coyotes, lynxes, marmots, porcupines, river otters, red and Arctic fox species, beavers, snowshoe hares, muskrats, bald eagles, golden eagles, peregrine falcons, ospreys, great horned and northern hawk-owls. More than half a million caribou, including the Central Arctic, Western Arctic, Teshekpuk, and Porcupine herds, migrate through the central Brooks Range twice yearly, traveling north in summer, and south in winter. Caribou are important as a food source to native peoples. The park is the northernmost range limit for the Dall sheep. About 132 brown bears reside in the park and preserve, based on a density of about one bear per 100 square miles.

programme.title: North America's National Parks
programme.desc: Saguaro National Park is an American national park in Pima County, southeastern Arizona. The 92,000-acre (37,000 ha) park consists of two separate areas—the Tucson Mountain District (TMD) about 10 miles west of the city of Tucson and the Rincon Mountain District (RMD) about 10 miles east of the city—that preserve Sonoran Desert landscapes, fauna, and flora, including the giant saguaro cactus.An inventory of medium and large mammals in the park confirmed the presence of 30 species in Saguaro National Park between 1999 and 2008. Of these, 21 were found in the Tucson Mountain District and 29 in the Rincon Mountain District. A partial list of the park's mammals includes cougars, coyotes, bobcats, white-tailed deer, mule deer, javelinas, gray foxes, black-tailed jackrabbits, desert cottontails, ring-tailed cats, white-nosed coatis, ground squirrels, and packrats. One endangered mammal, the lesser long-nosed bat, lives part of the year in the park and part of the year in Mexico.

programme.title: North America's National Parks
programme.desc: Yellowstone National Park is an American national park located in the western United States, largely in the northwest corner of Wyoming and extending into Montana, and Idaho. It was established by the U.S. Congress and signed into law by President Ulysses S. Grant on March 1, 1872. Yellowstone was the first national park in the U.S. and is also widely held to be the first national park in the world. The park is known for its wildlife and its many geothermal features, especially Old Faithful geyser, one of its most popular. While it represents many types of biomes, the subalpine forest is the most abundant. It is part of the South Central Rockies forests ecoregion.

programme.title: North America's National Parks
programme.desc: North America’s National Parks are world famous and their breathtaking landscapes fascinate millions of visitors. This spectacular series will show you what happens beyond the lookouts. Everglades National Park is an American national park that protects the southern twenty percent of the original Everglades in Florida. The park is the largest tropical wilderness in the United States, and the largest wilderness of any kind east of the Mississippi River. An average of one million people visit the park each year. Everglades is the third-largest national park in the contiguous United States after Death Valley and Yellowstone. UNESCO declared the Everglades & Dry Tortugas Biosphere Reserve in 1976, and listed the park as a World Heritage Site in 1979, while the Ramsar Convention included the park on its list of Wetlands of International Importance in 1987. Everglades is one of only three locations in the world to appear on all three lists.

programme.title: North America's National Parks
programme.sub-title: America's National Parks - Great Smoky Mountains
programme.desc: Great Smoky Mountains National Park is an American national park in the southeastern United States, with parts in Tennessee and North Carolina. The park straddles the ridgeline of the Great Smoky Mountains, part of the Blue Ridge Mountains, which are a division of the larger Appalachian Mountain chain. The park contains some of the highest mountains in eastern North America, including Clingmans Dome, Mount Guyot, and Mount Le Conte. The border between the two states runs northeast to southwest through the center of the park. The Appalachian Trail passes through the center of the park on its route from Georgia to Maine. With 12.5 million visitors in 2019, the Great Smoky Mountains National Park is the most visited national park in the United States.

programme.title: North America's National Parks
programme.desc: Olympic National Park is an American national park located in the State of Washington, on the Olympic Peninsula. The park has four regions: the Pacific coastline, alpine areas, the west side temperate rainforest and the forests of the drier east side. Within the park there are three distinct ecosystems which are subalpine forest and wildflower meadow, temperate forest, and the rugged Pacific coast. President Theodore Roosevelt originally designated Mount Olympus National Monument on 2 March 1909. The monument was redesignated as a national park by Congress and President Franklin Roosevelt on June 29, 1938. In 1976, Olympic National Park was designated by UNESCO as an International Biosphere Reserve, and in 1981 as a World Heritage Site. In 1988, Congress designated 95 percent of the park as the Olympic Wilderness.

programme.title: North America's National Parks
programme.desc: Yosemite National Park is a place of superlatives: with towering cliffs and giant sequoias, home to coyotes, black bears and the most elusive of all: the bobcat. Watch this documentary with ist spectacular shots, aerial views and time-lapse shots and learn some new facts about the biodiversity in one of North Americas most spectacular National Parks.

programme.title: The U.S. East Coast
programme.sub-title: The U.S. East Coast, The City and the Sea
programme.desc: The journey up the coast continues through Delaware to suburban New Jersey, and onwards into the heart of Manhattan. In Delaware, famous as a corporate tax haven, we visit a winery. In New York City we zip around with a bicycle courier and then head out to Long Island for oysters.

programme.title: The U.S. East Coast
programme.sub-title: The U.S. East Coast, Florida - The Sunshine State
programme.desc: Nowhere is the American way of life as relaxed as on Florida's beaches. The Keys, a chain of islands at the far southern end of the state, reveal a more laid-back side of the USA. But all of Florida amazes -- with secluded beaches, unspoiled nature, and the legacy of the early European settlers.

programme.title: The U.S. East Coast
programme.sub-title: The U.S. East Coast, The Heart of New England
programme.desc: From New York, the journey up the coast leads into the heart of New England. We visit Yale; spend some time in the 19th century mansions at Newport, RI; tour the coastal fishing and vacation towns of Massachusetts, and then meet a modern entrepreneur in Boston and see her rooftop gardens.

programme.title: Of Shark And Man
programme.desc: One man’s attempt to tell an untold story finds him in the middle of a shark feeding frenzy.

programme.title: The Original Whale Riders
programme.desc: A scientist studies whale parasites to protect them, but contact is risky due to their size and force.

programme.sub-title: Amazon Trek In Search of the Jaguar
programme.desc: Max seeks the elusive jaguar in Brazil's Pantanal and Amazon, testing his skills in the wild.
